smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found in the provided file.
All use cases in the diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are associated with at least one actor (e.g., 'Aktiivsed autod' is connected to 'Uudistaja').
No use cases with synonymous names for the same actor were found. 'Vaata autode koondaruannet' and 'Vaata kõiki autosid' describe different activities (summary vs list).
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package.
No redundant data columns without Foreign Key connections were detected. For example, 'Auto' contains foreign keys like 'auto_mark_kood' pointing to 'Auto_mark', avoiding redundancy of the mark name.

Inconsistent naming form found on Page 2: The use case 'Aktiivsed autod' starts with a noun (Noun Phrase), while others like 'Tuvasta kasutaja' and 'Vaata kõiki autosid' start with a verb (Verb Phrase).
In the state diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud, Lõpetatud) are reachable via transitions from the start node.
In the activity diagram (Page 4), all actions (e.g., 'Otsi autot', 'Vali auto') are reachable through the decision flows.
All relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators where appropriate (e.g., 0..* to 1).
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 15) has 9 tables.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connections on a single page. The Class 'Isik' on Page 6 has 5 connections (Kasutajakonto, Riik, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Töötaja, Klient).
The layout of the diagrams is balanced, and no related elements are placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.
On Page 2, the use case 'Aktiivsed autod' does not start with an active verb; it is a noun phrase describing a set of objects.
No element names (class, table, attribute, use case) were found with 3 or fewer characters. Shortest names like 'Isik', 'Riik', and 'Auto' are 4 characters long.
All class names (e.g., Isik, Auto, Töötaja) start with an uppercase letter and are singular.
All attribute/column names (e.g., e_meil, nimetus, reg_aeg) start with a lowercase letter.
All table names (e.g., Isik, Auto, Riik) are in the singular form.
No type prefixes (like tbl_, str_) were found in class, table, or attribute names. (Note: PK_, FK_ are allowed by the rule).
